properties.description: Before returning to Sicily for the winter months, Roger II stopped at Salerno.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II bypassed Troia and moved on to Greci, where he planned to attack Rainulf's lands for his decision to protect Troia.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Appeared at Ponte S. Valentino
properties.description: Roger II is recorded to have been at Ponte S. Valentino on this date.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Robert II is Halted at Scafati
properties.description: Because Roger II destroyed the wooden bridge crossing the River Sarno, Robert II's army was halted at Scafati.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Count Rainulf II journeyed to Benevento to renew his alliance with the city.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Rainulf Traveled to Naples to Request Military Aid
properties.description: In preparation for Roger II, Rainulf traveled to Naples and asked for its people to provide military aid against the king.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: To gather more men, Rainulf II attempted to encourage the able-bodied men of Aversa to join him in fighting Roger II.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: On the way to Melfi, Roger destroyed the city of Ascoli.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: On 28 September 1133, Roger II stopped at Rapolla and gave a charter to the nuns of St. Maria, Brindisi.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Instead of journeying to Melfi, Roger II stops at the city of Gravina instead
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Rainulf and Terra di Lavoro were unable to cross the River Sarno because the bridge at Scafati was destroyed.  All other paths were guarded heavily by Roger's men.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Paduli is Passed Through by Roger II's Forces
properties.description: Roger II goes through Paduli on his way to Ponte
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Rainulf II, on hearing of his lost lands, begins to seek out Roger II to make peace.  He stops at the fortress of Dugenta.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Visited the Monastery of Telese on This Year
properties.description: Roger II was well-received at the monastery and made a promise to give it enough silver to replace its altar pieces.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Alexander, Abbot of Telese
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Aversa was Protected by Royal Forces
properties.description: Emir John and Guarin the Chancellor arrived in the city to remind its people to stay faithful to Roger II.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: In addition to garrisoning other towns, Emir John gathers forces with himself at Cicala.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Guarin marched to Alife on orders of Roger II and ordered their surrender, which was accepted.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Guarin marched to Rabicano on orders of Roger II and ordered their surrender, which was accepted.  Richard, brother to Count Rainulf II and lord of the city, fled upon Guarin's approach.
properties.people:
Guarin, Chancellor
Richard, brother to Count Rainulf II
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Guarin was met with resistance at Caiazzo to submit to Roger II's rule.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Like in Caiazzo, S. Agata refused to submit to Roger II's rule.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Brief Visit in Alife by Roger II
properties.description: Roger II briefly stopped in Alife during the campaigning season to check its defenses.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: After their defeat at Fratte, the Pisans met back at Naples.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II stopped at Benevento on his way back to Sicily for the winter months.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II moved to the fort known as Guardina and inspected its defenses.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II traveled to Dragoni and inspected its defenses.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Visited the Monastery of Telese Again on This Year
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II inspected the defenses of Caizzo and ordered his nearby barons to settle the area so it would be defended.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II returned to Capua after the election of William.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: On his way back to Sicily, Roger II stopped to inspect the defenses of Arpaia.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: After Arpaia, Roger II stopped to inspect the defenses of Montesarchio as well.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II stopped briefly to inspect Tocco Caudio's defenses.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
